name: Holyrood apartHOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As already stated, it's £6 return from Edinburgh Airport to Waverly Station as opposed to around £20 single trip in a taxi. We then walked for around 15 mins to get to the hotel. Walking into room 406. there was a corridor with 4 rooms off it. A main bedroom with en-suite shower-room and toilet, a second double bedroom, a separate bathroom with bath and shower and a main living room/dining and kitchen area. The kitchen has a dishwasher, washing machine, fridge etc and is fully kitted out with all you need. The place was absolutely spotless. The service was fine, no complaints. There is free internet in the foyer with a printer to print off those plane-tickets for home. I only have 1 small complaint, the windows don't have proper seals, so you can hear outside noise, albeit you are in a quiet area and the floorboards creak, so you can hear people moving upstairs, but this did not spoil our stay. It still well deserves 5 stars and I would not hesitate in returning!
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.text: Just got back from a fantastic weekend in Edinburgh with my mum. Fabulous location, fabulous staff at Holyrood and the apartment was amazing! We had everything we needed plus more, i have never felt so comfortable whilst being away from home and I have travelled a lot. Can't fault anything at all!
reviews.title: Best apartments I have ever stayed at!

reviews.text: Arriving in Edinburgh airport, we used the airport bus to get to Waverly Station and then got a taxi to the hotel. A return bus ticket is £6 a person and takes about 25-30 mins, while the taxi is about £4. The distance from the station is walkable in 10 mins or so, but the combination of luggage, a lunch booking and finding the hotel for the first time swayed us in favour of the taxi. Useful landmarks are the Pizza Express and bar on Holyrood Road at the bottom of the entry the hotel is on. The entry the hotel is on also connects through to the Royal Mile, which is more direct than going via Holyrood Road for access to most central locations.
reviews.title: Resonably priced, convenient location in Edinburgh

reviews.text: Our room was ready when we arrived at 13:30 so we where able to check-in, which was quick and efficient. A key card was made available for all people in the room and a member of staff escorted us up to our room to give us a quick tour of the facilities.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great Staff - Rooms quite Noisy

reviews.text: The apartment was clean and modern with a double and twin room as requested. Beds were comfortable. There were two bathrooms, one ensuite with a shower, toilet and sink and one main bathroom which had disabled access. The sink in that bathroom was a bit of a nuisance because it was so low and small, but not a major issue. Shower was an electric mira sport, a decent make, and I would describe the water pressure as ok, though nothing to get excited about. Shampoo, shower gel, conditioner and moisturiser where provided in both bathrooms and there was a hair dryer in each bed room. That might seem obvious, but I stayed in the self catering accommodation of another hotel recently that only provided hand soap!
reviews.title: We were very pleased with the apartment and the staff!

reviews.text: The hotel has excellent facilities with regards to a kitchenette, TV, hot water etc. The rooms are really big, so a room for two people would actually have two separate rooms for each person.
reviews.title: Very good with huge rooms

reviews.text: It is clean, well maintained and keeps its standard high.
reviews.title: Home away from home in Edinburgh

reviews.text: The location is also amazing, as you can reach the Royal Mile within 3 minutes walking. The staff is helpful in trying to provide relevant information and is courteous.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.text: We went to Edinburgh over the Christmas period to catch up with family & decided to stay at the Holyrood Apathotel for three nights. The two bedroom apartment was fabulously clean & modern. The complimentary breakfast given to us for the first night was sizeable & lasted our complete stay. The doors & the floorboards are a bit squeaky which made it a challenge for "Santa" to drop off his goodies but he managed. The location is perfect. A few minutes walk to the Royal Mile & close to all the touristy places that we wanted to visit. Definitely a great choice if you want more space than a hotel room but still like to be amongst things.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights over Thanksgiving w/our teenage son. We were visiting our daughter, who attends U of Edinburgh and the Holyrood was right down the street from her dorm/flat so very convenient. Also very convenient to the Royal Mile. Our 2-bedroom apartment was absolutely spotless and larger than I thought it would be. It was a great place to unwind after sightseeing all day. For the space and amenities here, you can't beat the price compared to most other hotels in Edinburgh. I must say the employees are extremely patient and very helpful. Service with a smile always. We did not have a car and just walked everywhere. The Pizza Express next door was really good. We also ate at Worlds End, Deacon Brody's, Filling Station(all very good), The Balmoral (disappointing food and service IMO). Ordered out Chinese one night which I would not recommend, the Chinese food in Edinburgh is hard to come by and not very good. Took the train to St. Andrews for a day trip, saw Edinburgh Castle, St. Giles Cathedral, Greyfriars cemetary, went to the outdoor farmers market for lunch (only on Saturdays) nearby Edinburgh Castle, wandered around Grassmarket, and went to a Hibernians soccer/football game (very fun!) Can't say enough about the friendly, warm people of Edinburgh, we enjoyed every moment of our first visit to the UK! We can see why our daughter loves Edinburgh so much!
reviews.title: Loved it here!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holyrood with a 1.5 year old and it was a very positive experience. We wanted a separate bedroom for my son and kitchen with washer/dryer but were really surprised by how great it was overall. The rooms were a good size, everything was clean and modern and the kitchen was way more stocked than I'd expected. The hotel supplied a travel cot and highchair (at pre-trip request) for my son and they looked brand new. The staff were helpful in so many ways.
reviews.title: Highly recommend Holyrood - checked all the boxes

reviews.text: I'd read reviews about loud pipes and squeaky floors. I didn't notice the pipes. Yes the floors squeaked a bit but I could walk around while my little one was napping and it was no problem. Do not let comments about squeaky floors put you off. This is a fantastic place to base yourself from and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Very good
A hidden gem
reviews.text: We were more than satisfied with our overall stay at the Holyrood Aparthotel. Our two bedroom appartment was clean and spacious and all the basic equipment was provided. Location was perfect and the stuff very helpful.

We stayed here for five nights and had a great experience. Rachel and the rest of the staff were beyond helpful and helped us with car for hire reservations and restaurant reservations. Anything we asked for they helped. The breakfast included on the first day lasted us 3 to 4 days. The location was spectacular with a hotel and restaurant next door to eat and we were right off the Royal Mile was took you everywhere in town. There was also a hop on hop off bus stop on the street in front of us.
reviews.title: All you need in a place to stay

reviews.text: IF you do stay here, please note that if you face the courtyard, front of the apartments, it gets roudy and loud at night. We were woken up by drunk guests every night, so make sure to ask for a room facing away.
reviews.title: Good hotel, clean, comfortable and great location

reviews.text: I don't really want to tell everyone in case they get so busy I can't stay again soon, but these apartments in a hotel style complex are excellent. We had a two bedroom apartment , ensuite AND bathroom, living room with LCD TV and stocked kitchen. A real home from home and a blessing if you have young children. We will stay here next time in Edinburgh. The staff are helpful, polite and professional and the cleanliness outstanding. I can't find fault. Even the parking is a very reasonable £8.50 per day which is good for Edinburgh, but not many spaces so book in advance. The apartments are a stones throw from the Royal Mile so you really are in the centre of things. 5- 10 min walk to Princess St. holyrood park is also across teh road if you want to relax under Arthurs seat. We have stayed in many places in Edinburgh but this is the best....so far !
reviews.title: Best in Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: brilliant location on the royal mile, secure car parking underneath, staff were very helpfull and also booked transport for us and helped with ideas for restaurants nearby ,very clean room and a lot more space than any hotel, livingroom/kitchen, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. will defintly stay here next time im in edinburgh.
reviews.title: better than any hotel

reviews.text: I visited Edinburgh for a long weekend with my parents. The apartment set-up was perfect, equipped with 2 bedrooms and a large kitchen and living room so we never felt crammed for space. The hotel was renovated recently and the rooms were very modern, clean, and eco-friendly. The staff at the hotel was very kind and was quick to offer us assistance in booking reservations to restaurants, calling taxis, and providing directions to tourist attractions nearby.
reviews.title: Delightful stay for my family in Edinburgh!

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was ideal, with easy access to the Royal Mile and Palace of Holyrood. The hop-on-hop-off tour buses were within 5 minute walk from the hotel. There are also many restaurants nearby on the Royal Mile.
reviews.title: I LOVE this place.

reviews.text: My parents and I enjoyed our stay at Holyrood Aparthotel and would recommend this hotel to families traveling through Edinburgh!
reviews.title: fantastic find

description: Holyrood Aparthotel offers you best hotel accommodation in Edinburgh. Choose one of our exclusive self catering apartments and enjoy the privacy & services of a hotel room but with with the freedom and space more like home.
